Package simu.model

Class MyEngine

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
simu.framework.Engine
simu.model.MyEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, IEngine
public class MyEngine extends Engine implements IEngine
MyEngine is the main simulation engine for the airport simulation. It handles the initialization, event processing, and results reporting. The engine manages various service points and customer flow through the airport.

  • Constructor Details

    • MyEngine

      public MyEngine(IControllerMtoV controller, int arrivalInterval, int checkinNum, int securityNum, int passportNum, int EUNum, int NonEUNum)
      Constructor for MyEngine. Initializes the engine with the specified parameters and service points.
      Parameters:
      controller - The controller for managing the simulation.
      arrivalInterval - The interval between customer arrivals.
      checkinNum - The number of check-in points.
      securityNum - The number of security check points.
      passportNum - The number of passport control points.
      EUNum - The number of EU gates.
      NonEUNum - The number of Non-EU gates.

    • MyEngine

      public MyEngine(IControllerMtoV controller, List<ServicePointConfig> configs)
      Constructor for MyEngine with service point configurations. Initializes the engine with the specified parameters and service points based on configurations.
      Parameters:
      controller - The controller for managing the simulation.
      configs - The list of service point configurations.

  • Method Details

    • initialization

      protected void initialization()
      Initializes the simulation by generating the first arrival event. This method is called at the start of the simulation to kick off the event generation process.
      Specified by:
      initialization in class Engine

    • runEvent

      protected void runEvent(Event t)
      Handles events based on their type during the B-phase of the simulation. Processes customer movement between service points and updates relevant data.
      Specified by:
      runEvent in class Engine
      Parameters:
      t - The event to be processed.

    • results

      protected void results()
      Handles the results of the simulation.
      Specified by:
      results in class Engine

    • pauseSimulation

      public void pauseSimulation()
      Pauses the simulation by setting the isRunning flag to false. This method can be called to temporarily halt the simulation process.

    • resumeSimulation

      public void resumeSimulation()
      Resumes the simulation by setting the isRunning flag to true. This method can be called to continue the simulation process after a pause.

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Checks if the simulation is currently running.
      Returns:
      true if the simulation is running, false otherwise.

    • setArrivalInterval

      public void setArrivalInterval(int arrivalInterval)
      Sets the arrival interval for the arrival process.
      Specified by:
      setArrivalInterval in interface IEngine
      Parameters:
      arrivalInterval - The new arrival interval in seconds.

    • setEUFlightPercentage

      public void setEUFlightPercentage(double percentage)
      Sets the percentage of flights allocated to the EU region based on a Bernoulli distribution.

      This method initializes a Bernoulli distribution generator with the given percentage, which simulates the likelihood of assigning a flight to the EU region.

      Specified by:
      setEUFlightPercentage in interface IEngine
      Parameters:
      percentage - The probability of success (0.0 <= prob <= 1.0). Represents the likelihood of a "successful" outcome in the Bernoulli trial.

    • getGraphData

      public HashMap<String,HashMap<String,Double>> getGraphData()
      Retrieves graph data from the model and sends it to the view through the controller. If the graph data is available, it returns the stored data. If no data is present, it returns null.
      Specified by:
      getGraphData in interface IEngine
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing graph data, or null if no data is available.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the simulation by clearing all service points and resetting the engine.
      Overrides:
      reset in class Engine

    • setSelectedAirport

      public void setSelectedAirport(String airport)
      Sets the selected airport for the simulation.
      Parameters:
      airport - The name of the selected airport.
